Bugs and terrible customer serviceI've lived in France, the States, and Taiwan. Over the past thirty years, I can recall having had seven banks. Of these banks, Boursorama is the absolute worst. Their customer service is a joke: You have to dig through menu after menu to send them an email, and then they send you a copy-pasted answer a bot could have sent -- and probably did. And that's just my most recent experience. In the past, when you could still hope to receive an answer that wasn't prewritten, I also had the joy of experiencing the life of a hot potato, with each representative dropping my case after one message so that the next representative could start again from scratch (and often contradict what the previous representative had told me to do).And since I live in Taiwan right now, I cannot even open an account in another French bank. I'm stuck and they know it.Date of experience: April 19, 2023

Comment: The Boursorama customer service is going down the drain
Experience Date: The Boursorama customer service is going down the drainI used to be very satisfied with this online bank and I have been a client of Boursorama for many years, but recently, the quality of the service has seriously deteriorated. I need to make an urgent bank transfer abroad. For security reasons, Boursorama has blocked the various bank transfer requests I made online. Consequently, I sent them an email through their portal asking for support, so the transfer could be made. While I got a notification acknowledging that my email had been received and that I will receive a confirmation to my email address, I never received such a confirmation. Furthermore, when I check on their website the history of my requests, I can see that the email request that I sent to them does not appear. I have tried to call the customer service several times and each time I got connected to a completely useless robot. As a last resort, I have requested to be called back. So far, no one has called me back. The bank transfer is urgent and I am completely stuck with a non existing customer service. The next step will be for me to close my bank account.Date of experience: November 24, 2022

Comment: Boursorama claims to be an easy to deal‚Ä¶
Experience Date: Boursorama claims to be an easy to deal‚Ä¶Mise √† jour:Boursorama, non content de recevoir un avis client n√©gatif, l'a d√©nonc√© √† Trustpilot comme "non bas√© sur une exp√©rience r√©elle". Or, cette exp√©rience est bien r√©elle, et calamiteuse. Ce proc√©d√© de d√©nonciation par Boursorama est au mieux malhonn√™te. Un conseil : am√©liorez votre service si vous ne souhaitez pas recevoir d'avis n√©gatifs.Boursorama claims to be an easy to deal with bank. Well, not if you're a non resident... But it's not all. here are a couple of examples:- Opening an account : as a non-resident, you need to provide some tax documents. Guess what: Boursorama does not recognize the official tax return form issued by the tax authorities. Customer service is useless : an other department said "not accepted". Then you get cryptic messages : to continue your opening process you need to submit other documents... which are not specified. When you connect to the website, you can't upload them. So you call the customer service who tells you to send it by email. And then, black hole...In the meantime, you may receive a SMS saying that you need to transfer 300‚Ç¨ to the account to validate its opening. Guess what, despite doing this, the account may not be created. Then you need to wait for the 300‚Ç¨ to be returned and you stat over.- Customer service : very uneven. Some assistants are good and polite, others take you for granted and are the limit of being disrespectful. Explanations on when you receive a message, for what, are less than clear. Latest in date : received an SMS announcing my account is open, and I will get an email with my credentials. (after 3 weeks struggling with the customer service). I receive an email about credit of a bonus. But no credential. Call to customer service : we send credentials 48 hours after announcing your account is open. Ooooh. Thanks for being so clear in your communication!So all in all, the first experience has been a disaster. Let's see how the operations go... Wish me luck.Date of experience: July 06, 2022

Highly unprofessional and disrespectful bankI am a client of Boursorama bank since June 2019, and I have recently applied to open LIVRET A for my two sons (one who was born in France, and other who was born in Pakistan). During the submission process, I was asked to upload the birth certificates which I did. For the one born in France, there was no issue as it was a birth certificate issued in France. However, for other, I received the following email with following point- l'acte de naissance est incomplet, la date et le lieu de naissance des parents sont absents du document. merci de nous faire parvenir une copie compl√®te du livret de famille ou une copie compl√®te de l'acte de naissance avec filiation de Muhammad et une copie du passeport du repr√©sentant l√©galThe issue is that the birth certificates issued in Pakistan have only the names of Parents and do not have dates and places of birth of Parents. Given that in Pakistan a document similar to livret famille does not exist, I have always provided this certificate to receive official documents for my son (Prefecture, Impots, etc) and have never faced an issue. However, to address this problem, I provided (parents) marriage certificate, our titre de sejour, our passports, etc to provide the proof and date of birth of parents. Given that, i am an existing client (and Boursorama has all my information) I did hope that this info will be fine. However, to my surprise, two days later I received a refusal for an account opening for my elder son. Anyways, I got a pseudo livret famille from the Embassy of Pakistan in Paris and reapplied. Again in a couple of days, i got a refusal.This whole episode is very strange for me. Because I do not understand why a DISCRIMINATION is being applied to one child and there is no issue for the other. Is it only because one has a birth certificate issued by a Town Hall in France while the other holds a birth certificate from Pakistan? Just to let you know the same birth certificate was accepted also by the ministry of interior of France. Therefore, i seriously wonder, if a document that is accepted all over, a bank is not willing to consider (and despite all extra parent-related information that was provided)Getting Livret A is not rocket science and i can get it with any bank (My other account is with BNP Paribas and they are after my life to get these plans for my children). After that i tried reaching out to multiple departments but all in vain. Yesterday, I received a letter from one Mr MEZARD. It is amazing how much attention is given to the details because the letter mentioned the reason as - application de nos conditions generals - but did not have the courtesy to specify what precisely is the CONDITION we did not fulfill. But that is because there is NO REAL CONDITION. It is just profile discrimination (possibly racism?) given that there are different documents (the one that had a French birth certificate had the account open vs. the other child having a foreign document). Anyways I have initiated the account opening with BNP Parisbas (Thank god they have the brains to relate). Of course, I will contact Banque de France but to launch a full-scale complaint and audit of the processes. I am also progressing with closure of my account and my suggestion to everyone will be to STAY AWAY from such a discorteous and disrecpectful bank with a useless customer serviceDate of experience: September 04, 2022

Experience Date: Probably the worst bank I have ever used.Honestly one of the worst banks ive ever dealt with. You log onto the website it says it has failed and the IT service are looking at it. It's been like this for months. You complete the capital deposit with them, which is actually a very good service, and in order to complete this deposit you have to sign up to the pro account. Once the account is set up you go onto the platform and have none of the pro features and they give you an option to pre-order the pro function. You call up the number they give you and it tells you to contact them through the site. It takes 3 days to hear anything back. Tried to make a transfer. Did not even recognise any of the 4 french IBAN I used. Tried to contact them but customer service is literally non-existent. I would recommend for the capital deposit but stay away from them if you are thinking of using them for banking.*Update since review* Anytime are quicker at getting back to you on trust pilot then they are on there own platform. If you want customer service just write a bad review, they will get back to you in a day. Since the review has been written they will not let me transfer money out of my account to close it. It sat pending for a week. When I asked them why it had not been sent they told me they didn't know. They called me back and told me the transfer would happen that day. The next day they email saying the transfer has been cancelled and to do it again. I did it again and I still havent had the transfer executed. They also tried to send me the card about 3 weeks after I had opened a pro account with them which failed even though a competitor bank sent me a brand new card next day to the same address. They claim they fixed the site. Issue is still blatantly there. Only when I write a bad review on trustpilot do they then provide me with the pro features that I paid for. Admission of guilt on their behalf. Tried to ask for a refund given that they had not given me the pro features, have not heard anything back in days. I just want do be done with anytime so I never have to have this experience as well but they wont let me leave. Last thing my accountant in France told me not to use anytime so clearly they don't have a good reputation. Be very careful about using them.Date of experience: August 04, 2021

Experience Date: Funds Missing in ActionI have been trying to hold off writing a review in this way, but my patience has run out.I set up an account with Anytime for my new French company. The aim, to buy a chalet and run it part as second home and part as business. The Anytime account was set up very quickly and efficiently. Obviously it would be, to get you on board.The first transaction was to be the property transaction, so I tested the account to ensure I could transfer funds in. I received my banking card. All looked good, efficient.I sent a message to the bank to inform them of the transaction and that they would be receiving 700,000 Euros, which I would then need to use to complete the transaction and develop the property. 30 hours later I get a message to say I can only send 10,000 Euros to the account, which can't have more than 50,000 in it. Too late, 30 hours is a long time and the funds have been transferred. This credit and transfer limit is a very material term. I still cannot see the terms and conditions that state it.8 days later, I still do not have the 700,000 Euros back, how crazy is that. The day for completion of the purchase has passed earlier this week. Signing has happened, but I have let the Sellers down. I have no way to access the funds, they are in the system.I keep asking for progress and providing all information requested. I may ask 5 to 10 questions in messages in a day. 48 hours at the earliest I get a reply to one question. The rest of the questions go unanswered. The Bank is faceless and you never get the same person answering messages. There is no conversation. You can't call.Banks have a duty of care to their customers. Duties around client monies are pretty high. These duties are simply not being respected at all.The Bank are saying that they are seeking to increase the credit and transfer limit. They know the urgency, but it has taken 6 days and still documents uploaded have not been looked at. When I ask if they can find the funds, they say it will be at least 7 days, but provide no rationale for this and no information on the funds. They have the transfer certificates, so they know they received it.This bank is set up for every day business. Anything not in the everyday mundane transactions will not work. They are unable to deal with specific requests, whether in chat, messages or on the telephone. They need to rework the model as all businesses have some extraordinary transactions.A faceless bank that shirks its responsibilities and hides behind the answers the internal systems give it.I hope they may right this and then prove me wrong, but I would be foolish to hold my breath.Date of experience: August 12, 2021
